page.title: 17Transport _ Highways
page.content: The roads within the area are administered by Lincolnshire County Council to the east and Nottinghamshire Couty Council to the west.The county boundary runs almost half way through the area from north to south.All roads are Class B minor routes.They are covered with a top surface of crushed gravel.Notts. roads have centre white line markings,while Lincs roads only have markings at junctions etc.Although the road surface in Lincs remains quite good verge grass cutting and snow clearance in winter has suffered over the past few years through cuts in capital expenditure.Nottinghamshire with less cuts have come off better and their routes tend to be in a better state of repair.
